items.title: Gaza death toll tops 69,000 as Israel and militants again exchange remains
items.summary_auto: More than 69,000 Palestinians have been killed in the Israel-Hamas war so far, Gaza health officials said Saturday, as both sides completed the latest exchange of bodies under the terms of the tenuous ceasefire.

items.title: Super Typhoon Fung-wong makes landfall after forcing more than 1 million people to evacuate
items.summary_auto: Super Typhoon Fung-wong slammed ashore on Sunday in the northeastern coast of the Philippines, where the massive storm had already left at least two people dead and forced more than a million people to evacuate from flood- and landslide-prone areas, officials said.

items.title: Super typhoon threatens the Philippines, forcing more than 1 million people to evacuate
items.summary_auto: Super Typhoon Fung-wong, the biggest storm to threaten the Philippines this year, started battering the country's northeastern coast ahead of landfall on Sunday, knocking down power, forcing the evacuation of more than a million people and prompting the defence chief to warn many others to evacuate to safety from high-risk villages before it's too late.

items.title: Tears, shouts and courage as Rock & Roll Hall of Fame welcomes new inductees
items.summary_auto: Cyndi Lauper turned “True Colors” into a defiant call for courage and the music of Outkast, Soundgarden and the White Stripes moved the house on Saturday night at the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony.

items.title: What’s in the federal budget for you? Your questions answered
Canada could face ‘worst kind’ of flu season as experts warn evolving strain may be mismatch for vaccine
items.summary_auto: With flu cases now rising in Canada, medical experts are bracing for a difficult influenza season linked to the global spread of an evolving H3N2 strain that could be a mismatch for this year’s vaccine.

items.title: Old caves yield new secrets from Canadians who went over the top at Vimy Ridge
items.summary_auto: A hidden archive of what for many were last thoughts and tributes to Canada is emerging from the soft chalk tunnels beneath the Vimy Ridge battlefield more than a century after they were created.

items.title: Advocates concerned temporary immigration cuts don't address systemic issues
NDP MP ‘very confident’ no New Democrats will cross floor to Liberals as budget vote nears
items.summary_auto: B.C. NDP MP Gord Johns says he’s “very confident” none of the seven New Democrats in the House of Commons will cross the floor to the Liberals — even as he admits he’s regularly approached by the Liberals.

items.title: Saskatchewan Roughriders to face Montreal Alouettes at next week's Grey Cup
items.summary_auto: The Saskatchewan defence forced back-to-back two-and-out possessions to give their offence an opportunity to win the game.

items.title: Riders score late TD to down Lions, punch ticket to Grey Cup
items.summary_auto: The Saskatchewan defence forced back-to-back two-and-out possessions to give their offence an opportunity to win the game.

items.title: Tania Willard wins the 2025 Sobey Art Award
items.summary_auto: Known for her work with Indigenous land-based practices, the artist from Niskonlith, B.C., is the recipient of the $100,000 grand prize.

items.title: Canada's Indigenous veterans faced tough battles — abroad and at home
items.summary_auto: Canada marks Indigenous Veterans Day on Saturday, shining a spotlight on wartime experiences that historian Scott Sheffield says was a place where some would find a sense of belonging, away from racism at home.
